message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about language modeling, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a new training method for neural networks, which is relevant to machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.LG and cs.AI likely sub-categories as well. The use of random fields and neural networks also suggests that cs.NE (neural and evolutionary computing) could be a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of language models for sentence rescoring, which could be relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) tasks such as image captioning.
